data.text: @xavierbonilla87 This comment is probably not helpful,  but reading Either /Or reminds me of how I felt reading, How To Be an Antiracist. Circular arguments that seem to intentionally obfuscate. Kierkegaard is often funny, though,  and Kendi seemed mellow dramatic and somewhat manipulative.

data.text: Finished Ibram X. Kendi's @DrIbram How to Be an Antiracist last night. The ending was a total unexpected 💥. Incredibly courageous piece of work - going to be processing for a while. https://t.co/wwF4Nzsxfn

@desiraethinking @xavierbonilla87 p. 48 of "How to be an Antiracist."  He's in third grade.  The quote has been miscontextualized. In no way does it reflect Kendi's thinking as an adult.  (I'm no fan of the book, but I am a fan of good-faith disagreements, not this sort of cherrypicking.)

@angryray66 Education. She does classes about diversity in the classroom. While I am experienced in the field already it is a very good class. We are currently talking about the poverty deficit theory and how it is a fallacy. We read the books "Troublemakers" and "How to be an Antiracist."
@desiraethinking Pg. 48 in how to be an antiracist. 😊 I’m willing to accept I may have read it wrong but I read it a few times and I don’t think so.

data.text: @DrIbram @SophiaThomas I'm listening to How to Be An Antiracist, and I find myself having to rewind and re-listen because some of the statistics are so disturbing. My brain says, "WHAT???!!!!" Thank you for writing such a brilliantly researched and written work.

data.text:
Great book from @DrIbram

Reading it provided means to reflect and dissect thoughts/assumptions I have and a means to place the recent events into a context.

Check out this book on Goodreads: How to Be an Antiracist https://t.co/Zm5L4nTS4j
Recommended reading: How to be an Antiracist by Ibram X. Kendi. #CSIKraken @RosaSheng

Quoted from 

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

“...do not violate the equal protection clause of the US constitution.”

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

data.text:
“In 1986 during the violent crack epidemic, 3,380 more Americans died from alcohol-related traffic deaths than from homicide.”

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter
~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

“... Asante’s contention that objectivity was really collective subjectivity.”

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

“With black poverty dense and white poverty scattered, black poverty is visible and surrounds its victims; white poverty blends in.”

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

domain.description: Named people in the world like Nelson Mandela
domain.name: Person

data.text:
“Prince Henry’s Portugal birth3d conjoined twins -capitalism and racism - when it initiated the transatlantic slave trade of African people.”

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

“It is impossible to know racism without understanding it’s intersection with capitalism.”

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

To be Antiracist is to say that political and economic conditions, not the people, in poor neighborhoods, are pathological.  

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

How we frame the problem and who we frame as the problem, shapes the answers we find.

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

In the end, anti-white racist ideas, by taking some of all of the focus off racial power, become anti-black.

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter

We must separate the warlike, greedy bigotted and individualistic cultures of modern empire and racial capitalism ... from the cultures of white people.  They are not one and the same.

~ Ibram X Kendi, in “How to be an Antiracist” #antiracist #blacklivesmatter
